content: 5dc in each chain-1 space around slip_stitch to beginning single_crochet fasten_off prettyknittyjewelry designs 2023 llc trim for hood and cradle with cc and smaller hook join yarn into the corner where hood and side of cradle meet row 1 single_crochet in this st single_crochet evenly across the edge sts of the hood finishing with one stitch in the opposite corner this should be 10-12 sts ch1 but do not turn row 2 reverse single_crochet in each st across the edge of the hood and continue working reverse single_crochet around the top of the sides of the cradle using the remaining loops finish off note where the hood is joined you may not have free back loops to minimize the cc that shows through when the purse is closed use the same loops you picked up to create the hood drawstrings make 2 chain 100 and fasten_off weave one end of each drawstring over/under v-sts in round 3 i weave into the center of the v-sts to help me keep track of where the weave goes over/under sets of 2 double_crochet sts after weaving tie ends together and weave in to close purse tuck in hood fold up sides and pull ends of drawstrings to open pull open the top of the purse and fold the skirt down fluff hood tiny baby blanket does your little doll or bear look cold well perhaps it needs a tiny baby blanket if you also knit this is easy to do with some leftover sock-weight yarn and size 1 knitting needles or a tiny crochet hook any knitting or crochet pattern can be adapted to a smaller size here s the formula for the one pictured below cast on 33 sts row 1-4 k1 p1 to last st knit last stitch turn row 5 and all odd row k1 p1 k1 k27 k1 p1 k1 turn row 6 and all even row k1 p1 k1 p5 k1 p7 k1 x2 p5 k1 p1 k1 turn repeat row 5 & 6 until blanket is as long as you d like maybe a tiny bit short to allow for border repeat row 1-4 once and bind off loosely note the bind off doesn t need to be too stretchy it should match the cast on closely now tuck in your sweet baby and have a little nap yourself you have earned it i ve made this pattern free for always because i d like it to bring joy…to you and perhaps to a child that you love as well drop me a line at
